info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Arapahoe, central Denver and western Adams Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern Denver, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... central and eastern Denver, northwestern Aurora, eastern Thornton, Commerce City, Brighton, western Denver International Airport, Barr Lake and Todd Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
